title: PTI has done nothing but politics of hate and division: Barrister Danyal
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jul 15 (APP):Leader Pakistan Muslim League Nawaz (PML-N) Barrister Danyal Chaudhary on Monday said that Pakistan Tahreek-e-Insaf has done nothing for the country but only promoted the politics of hatred and division.
Addressing a press conference here, he said that a specific political party was given that relief which was not demanded, adding, that some people think that they can achieve their goals by blackmailing.
He said the coalition parties decided to file a review appeal on the current decision of the Supreme Court regarding reserved seats.
“Sometimes they (PTI) waved ciphers and sometimes hired lobbying firms, the country was abused and burned, besieged, these people attacked the institutions of their own country. May 9 was an example of PTI’s anti-state policies,” he lamented.
The leader of the PML-N said that sometimes there were talks of burning and sometimes closing Pakistan, seeds of hatred were sown in the country, adding that today we say no more, we got this country in a destabilizing condition, and the economy was derailed during PTI’s four-year tenure.
He further said that if PTI’s agenda was political, then they would not have dissolved their assemblies. He said that when we were negotiating with the IMF, they(PTI) were raising slogans against Pakistan.
Danyal Chaudhary said that important decisions will be taken by taking all the parties on board, PTI founders Imran Khan, Arif Alvi, and Qasim Suri have weakened Pakistan, and action will be taken against those who sit abroad and talk about breaking Pakistan.
The PML-N leader further said that “strict action will be taken against the non-state actors, the government will not be blackmailed in any way. The reference to the imposition of Article 6 will be sent to the Supreme Court. we repeatedly talked about the Charter of Economy. Unfortunately, PTI thinks our patience is our weakness”.
He said the allies will be taken on board in major decisions, and all the coalition parties will stand with the government.
